page.title: 12UNDERBANK HALL
page.content: and one of them may be the ghost. They tell a story of a travelling monk whose spirit still inhabits Underbank Hallalthough the man died hundreds of years ago. In 1959 Saml. Fox & company (the local steel works since 1842) bought the Hall from Michael West de Wend Fenton for Â£4300, for meetings and banquets and as a guest house. In1480 Underbank Hall was owmed by the West family, but changed hands in the seventeenth century to William Fenton. The Hall has 18" all stone walls. In the house there is a smallstatue of a Bishop from the early 16th century. One of the bedrooms has a floor that slopes.it has 6 bedrooms and one spiral staircase.foriegn guests also come. they have a trap door especially for catching mice. (cont)
